title: SFEC 143 - Requests by Candidates for Independent Determination of Filings - Filings
description: SFEC Form 143 is used by any candidate for Mayor or the Board of Supervisors.  Candidates seeking the same office as a candidate identified in a communication may object to the Executive Directorâ€™s determination of whether a communication reported on filings required under section 1.161, 1.162 or 1.163 actually supports or opposes a candidate or is neutral. Such requests must be filed within one business day from the date the Executive Director makes his or her determination. This dataset includes SFEC Form 143 filings as of March 4, 2020.

columns.name: DocuSign ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the filing, generated automatically by DocuSign

columns.name: Filing
columns.description: URL to download PDF copy of the filing

columns.name: Filer Name
columns.description: Person/committee who filed the 496, 162 or 163 and the accompanying communication at issue

columns.name: Form or Report Number
columns.description: Form Number and Report Number (see page 1 of form)

columns.name: Expenditure Type
columns.description: Type of expenditure as identified by filer of the form, i.e., independent expenditure, electioneering communication, or member communication.

columns.name: Position
columns.description: Candidate's interpretation of the position of the communication: (1) support; or (2) oppose the candidate(s); or (3) be neutral

columns.name: Reason
columns.description: The reason why the candidate believes that the communication supports or opposes a candidate or is neutral.  Candidates may choose to attach this to the PDF filing in the "Filing" column.

columns.name: Candidate FPPC ID
columns.description: FPPC ID number of Candidate's campaign committee

columns.name: Date Signed
columns.description: Date form signed and filed by filer
